Socialism didn't create this.... corruption and outside interference from multinational corporations who were losing billions of dollars due to the Nationalization of the industries there that were using Venezuela's natural resources up.... that's what created the current issues facing Venezuela. The U.S and other capitalist based governments have created a myth that a political system that's designed to help the poor and working class is actually the biggest threat to it, and, by way of poor education systems and a lack of oversight of the alt Right whackos on the TV, radio, and Internet spreading lies, hate, and fear they've created an army of misinformed, pissed off voters willing to elect a rapist with ties to the Russians and the Mafia President.

An investigation doesn't prove guilt. More times than not it leaves innocence. So live in a guilty until proven innocent society now. It's disgusting. OK, the FBI has 100 people investigating. Awesome. No indictment yet though. Never mind proof of guilt. PS I'm team Bernie all the way. I'm defending the process, not Hillary.
I want my way and will do anything to get it

Jennifer it would INFURIATE me if that happened. Who takes stuff off of a baby's grave? I agree with Peggy-your baby boy is so filled with your love that he doesn't need the material things. He'll tell you so when you see him again <3

Hope they hunt down Muslim converts to know what they are doing throughout America! The family of the woman who was beheaded in the meat packing plant would have appreciated our government discovering this radical convert earlier than when he was beheading this woman.

Our president should tell these BLM rioters to go home already- they are disturbing the peace of our country. We have real problems to deal with - like Homeland Security. Look what's happening in the world - ISIS is terrorizing every nation! Their racial issues are on them at this point. They haven't the facts to even back them up. They have blood on their hands! They should be arrested by the hundred at this point, not applauded or appeased. Here are some facts: An African-American Harvard Economist, Roland G. Frye, Jr., just published findings that there is no racial differences between the deadly shootings of whites and blacks by law enforcement in America. He began his study because he was angered by black men being shot by white cops. But his study surprisingly found that police officers use deadly force when they perceive a threat, regardless of skin color. This data undercuts the entire BLM's argument. He summarized by stating """"Yes, there are some instances of criminal acts, but they are far and in between,"""" and """"they are not disproportionate by race.""""
You should probably wake him up because he looks like he might be hungry.

I'm not as avid a gamer as some, but I've found that some games are stunning in their creativity and content. Check out """"The Unfinished Swan"""". The music is beautiful, the game play is different, and the story is rather simple and poignant. I think video games are mediums that blend visuals, sounds, etc together in an attempt to tell a story. Imo, that is art: telling a story. Does that mean Call of Duty is art? Well, that's subjective, correct?
